item.title: Zechariah 1
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 1

1 The Eighth Month, Second Year of Darius A Message from Yahveh to the Prophet Zechariah Ben-Berechiah Ben-Iddo A Call to Return to Yahveh 2"IYwas angry with your ancestors. 3So tell the people, ‘Yahveh of hosts says, “Come back to me so I can come back to you. 4Don’t be like your ancestors that former prophets told to come back from their sinful ways and deeds, but they didn’t pay any attention. 5Where are those ancestors? Prophets don’t live forever, 6but my message commanded through them did come to bear on your ancestors. As a result, they repented and said, ‘Yahveh of hosts has dealt with us the way he intended, according to our ways and deeds.’”’"

item.title: Zechariah 2
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 2

1 Then I saw a man holding a measuring line, and 2asked him where he was going. “To measure how wide and long Jerusalem is."

3 The angel that was talking to me was leaving, and another angel met him 4and said, “Run and tell that young man, ‘Jerusalem will be lived in like open country because of the number of people and livestock that’s in it. 5I’ll be a fire wall around it and the glory in it. 6"Flee from up north where I’ve scattered you to the four winds. 7Zion! Escape, you exiles in Babylon.’ 8”‘It’s for glory that he has sent me against the nations that plundered you, because whoever touches you will be poking themselves in the eye. 9I’ll raise my fist over them so their slaves will plunder them. You’ll know Yahveh of Hosts has sent me. 10"Sing and be happy, Zion, because I’m coming to live among you. 11Many nations will join Yahveh then and become my people. I’ll live among you, and you’ll know Yahveh of Hosts has sent me to you. 12He’ll own Judah as his portion in the holy land and choose Jerusalem again.’"

item.title: Zechariah 3
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 3

1 Then he showed me Joshua/Jeshua the high priest standing in front of the angel of Yahveh, and Satan standing to his right to accuse him. 2Yahveh told Satan, “Yahveh rebuke you, Satan! I who chose Jerusalem reject your accusations! Isn’t this man a brand snatched out of the fire?"

3 Joshua’s clothes were dirty, 4so the angel told the ones standing there, “Change his dirty clothes.” “I’ve taken your sinfulness off so I can dress you up with festive robes."

item.title: Zechariah 4
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 4

1 The angel came back and brought me to as if I’d been asleep. 2He asked me what I saw. “A gold lampstand with its bowl of oil on top, as well as its seven lamps with one spout apiece. 3I see an olive tree on each side of it. 4What do they mean, Sir?” 5"Don’t you know?" “No.” 6"This is what Yahveh tells Zerubbabel, ‘Not by force, not by power, but by my Spirit. 7Not even a big mountain will be able to get in your way. You’ll set the cap stone for the Temple amid shouts of “God bless it!! God bless it!”’"

item.title: Zechariah 5
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 5

1 Then I looked up and saw a flying scroll.

2 He said, “What do you see?” “A flying scroll, 15 by 30ft."

3 He told me, “It contains the words of the curse that’s over the whole world. Everyone that steals will be erased from one side. Everyone that swears falsely will be erased from the other. 4Yahveh of Hosts will send the curse out to the thief’s house and to the house of the one that swears falsely by his name. The curse will remain there all night till it consumes its timbers and stones.’” A Woman in a Basket

item.title: Zechariah 6
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 6

1 I looked again and saw four chariots coming out from between two bronze mountains. 2Chestnut horses were pulling the first chariot, black horses the second, 3white horses the third, and powerful dappled-gray horses the fourth.

4 I asked the angel, “What are they, Sir?” 5"They’re the four spirits of heaven going out from the Lord of the whole world. 6One chariot is going north with the black horses; after them the white horses are going west. The dappled-gray horses are going south. 7Those powerful horses went out, chomping at the bit to patrol the world." He said, “Go on and patrol it.” So they did.

item.title: Zechariah 7
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 7

1 The Fourth Day, Ninth Month (Chislev), Fourth Year of King Darius A Message from Yahveh to Zechariah A Call for Justice and Mercy, Not Fasting

2 The people in Bethel had sent Sharezer, Regem-melech, and their men to ask for Yahveh’s blessing. 3They spoke to the priests in Yahveh’s Temple and to the prophets, “Should we keep mourning and fasting in the fifth month like we’ve done all these years?"

item.title: Zechariah 8
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 8

1 A Message from Yahveh Promised Blessings for Jerusalem 2"Yahveh of Hosts says, ‘I’m jealous for Zion. 3I’ll come back to live in Jerusalem, and it’ll be called The City of Truth. My mountain will be called The Holy Mount. 4Old men and women will sit in its streets again with staffs in hand because they’re old. 5Boys and girls will play in the streets. 6If that sounds incredible to the remnant that’s left, does that make it incredible for me? 7I’m going to save my people from lands east and west 8and bring them back to live here. They’ll be my people, and I’ll be their God, faithful and just.’ 9"Be strong, you that are listening to this message from the prophets who spoke when the foundation of myY Temple was being laid so it could be completely rebuilt. 10Before then there weren’t any jobs. Because criminals were everywhere, travelers weren’t safe; everybody was working against everybody else. 11But I won’t treat the remnant like that now. 12Their descendants will have peace, the grapevines will bear fruit, the ground will grow produce, the sky will drop dew. The remnant will inherit those things. 13Just as you were a curse among the nations, Judah and Israel, so I’ll save you to become a blessing. Don’t be afraid; be strong. 14"Just as I planned to punish you when your ancestors were so offensive to me and I didn’t hold back; 15so now I intend to treat Jerusalem and Judah well. Don’t be afraid! 16To have peace around you, tell the truth and judge honestly. 17Don’t make plots or commit perjury. I despise things like that."

item.title: Zechariah 9
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 9

1 A Message from Yahveh Against the Land of Hadrach [Aram] The message from Yahveh is against Damascus—for the eyes of all people, including the tribes of Israel, are on Yahveh—

2 against Hamath, which borders it, and against Tyre and Sidon, though they’re so very wise.

3 Tyre built a fortress, piled up silver like dust, and gold like dirt on the streets.

4 Yahveh will confiscate its possessions, throw its wealth into the sea; and burn it down.

item.title: Zechariah 10
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 10

1 Ask Yahveh for showers in the spring; the One that forms the storm clouds will give each farmer crops in his field.

2 Household gods speak nonsense; fortunetellers see false dreams and give empty consolation. So people wander in danger like lost sheep because they don’t have a shepherd. 3"My anger flares at the shepherds; I’ll punish the male goats, because I care about my flock, the House of Judah; I’ll make them like my majestic steed in battle.

item.title: Zechariah 11
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 11

1 Open your doors, Lebanon, so fire can consume your cedar forests.

2 Wail, cypress trees, for the fallen cedars; The stately trees have burned up. Wail, oaks of Bashan; the thick woodland has been cut down.

3 The shepherds wail because their good pasture’s gone. The young lions roar because the jungle by the Jordan is decimated.

4 Yahveh my God says, “Pasture the flock that’s doomed to slaughter. 5The buyers butcher them without remorse. The sellers say, ‘Praise Yahveh, I’m rich!’ Their own shepherds don’t care about them! 6I won’t have mercy on people like that. I’ll let them fall into each other’s hands and the hands of their king. They’ll ruin the land, and I won’t protect it."

item.title: Zechariah 12
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 12

1 A Message from Yahveh About Israel Future Destruction of Jerusalem’s Enemies This is what Yahveh says who stretched out the sky, laid earth’s foundation, and formed the human spirit: 2"I’m going to make Jerusalem a cup that makes every nation stagger who lays siege to Jerusalem and Judah. 3I’ll make Jerusalem a heavy rock; any nation that tries to pick it up will rupture itself. When nations surround it, 4I’ll make their horses bolt and their riders panic, but I’ll watch over Judah as I strike those enemies’ horses blind. 5The clans in Judah will realize that the residents of Jerusalem have strong protection from Yahveh of Hosts their God.’ 6"At that time, I’ll make the clans in Judah like a fire pot in a woodpile, a torch among bundles of grain. They’ll consume the nations around them while Jerusalem stays safe. 7Yahveh will save the people in Judah first so David’s royal line and Jerusalem won’t have greater glory than the rest of Judah. 8The weakest among the people in Jerusalem will be as strong as David, and his descendants will lead them out like God, like the angel of Yahveh. 9I’ll destroy any nation that attacks Jerusalem. The One They Have Pierced 10"I’ll pour out a spirit of grace and prayer on David’s family and the people in Jerusalem so they’ll look at me that they’ve speared. They’ll mourn for me like people mourn for an only son or a firstborn son. 11There’ll be extreme mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning for Hadad-rimmon on the Plain of Megiddo. 12Each clan in Israel will mourn by itself, husbands and wives separately: the clans of Nathan, 13Levi, the Shimeites, and 14the rest. The Cleansing Fountain

item.title: Zechariah 13
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 13

1 Then a fountain will spring up for David’s house and the people in Jerusalem, a fountain for cleansing sin and impurity. 2I’ll get rid of the idols in Israel; they’ll fade from memory. I’ll remove false prophets and unclean spirits. 3If anybody still tries to make up their own prophecy, their own parents will say, ‘You’ve lied in Yahveh’s name!’ and they’ll run them through. 4People will be averse to claiming they’ve had visions; they won’t put on a prophet’s hairy robe to create impressions. 5They’ll say, ‘I’m not a prophet; I plow ground because a man sold me as a slave when I was a kid.’ 6If somebody asks him, ‘Where did those scars come from around your wrists?’ he’ll say, ‘From wounds at “a friend’s” house!’ The Shepherd Struck, the Sheep Scattered

item.title: Zechariah 14
item.description:
Zechariah Chapter 14

1 Yahveh will bring a time when nations will plunder you right in front of you. 2He’ll gather them against Jerusalem and capture it. The houses will be looted and the women raped; half the people will be exiled and the rest abandoned among the ruins.

3 But then Yahveh will go out and fight them. 4His feet will stand on the Mount of Olives east of Jerusalem. The mountain will split apart east to west, half moving north and half moving south with a wide valley between. 5You’ll escape by that valley, which will reach as far as Azal. You’ll flee like you did from the earthquake when Uzziah reigned in Judah. Then Yahveh my God will come with his holy ones! 6There won’t be any cold or frost, 7a unique day known only to Yahveh, without day or night; there’ll be light in the evening. 8At that time, water will pour out of Jerusalem year around, half to the Dead Sea and half to the Mediterranean.
